title: Cultivate Your Own Edamame: A Guide to Growing and Enjoying Soybeans!

subtasks: Obtaining soybean seeds or transplants
Preparing planting containers with suitable soil mix
Planting soybean seeds or transplants in containers
Watering newly planted soybeans
Monitoring for pests and diseases (caterpillars, spider mites, rust)
Applying neem oil as a pest control treatment
Providing full sunlight (6-8 hours daily)
Fertilizing soybeans with organic liquid fertilizer and worm tea
Harvesting soybean pods when mature
Removing spent plants after harvest
Preparing edamame dish (air frying with oil and salt)
Cooking soybeans for consumption
